document_title: Coronary artery disease: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content:
Coronary artery disease or coronary insufficiency is a condition in which the main blood vessels supplying blood to the heart are narrowed or blocked by atherosclerotic plaques, causing blood flow to the heart to decrease. (first)
There are two types of disease: acute coronary syndrome and chronic coronary artery disease:
Acute coronary syndrome is a condition that includes unstable angina and acute myocardial infarction, occurring due to complete blockage of the coronary artery, acutely due to ruptured atherosclerotic plaque or thrombosis. ; In contrast, chronic coronary artery disease often occurs silently and progresses over decades. Symptoms of the disease appear and gradually increase as the progression of coronary stenosis worsens over time.
subsection_title: benh mach vanh.json. What is coronary artery disease?

Acute coronary syndrome is a condition that includes unstable angina and acute myocardial infarction, occurring due to complete blockage of the coronary artery, acutely due to ruptured atherosclerotic plaque or thrombosis. ; In contrast, chronic coronary artery disease often occurs silently and progresses over decades.
